data.title: Added an optional desktop shortcut for Windows
data.body: only tested it on Linux with Wine which probably does not count https://www.dropbox.com/s/epx8wdwp4onm4uk/OpenRA-test-desktop-shortcut.exe

data.title: Bring back damage per second evaluations
data.body: Published by @chrisforbes at http://blogs.ijw.co.nz/chris/index.php/2010/05/first-of-many-public-balancing-aids-for-openra-dpstool/

data.title: game is VERY slow and lags
data.body: I am not sure if it might just be me, but since the new release I had hardly any games without lag....is this possible?

data.title: Windows desktop shortcut option in the NSIS installer
data.body:
It would be useful to have a Windows desktop shortcut option in the NSIS installer.

https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3830

data.title: D2k , several graphic/frame bugs
data.body:
ugly spice edges : 
http://i.imgur.com/hbYtTYf.png

spice ref overlapping the harvester (and probably other vehicles/units) : 
http://i.imgur.com/3I8bvDY.png

infantry-group running over a trike : 
http://i.imgur.com/iUkpSfv.png

infantry stops @ a specific frame and theres no "idle" animation going on  , 
here they r freezed in a shooting frame : 
http://i.imgur.com/wW3XWAW.png

data.title: walls dont protect
data.body: Tanks and other units can shoot "over" walls. Walls are pretty useless now. It was important to protect buildings like chrono from heavy attacks.

data.title: Test if Map is okay and playable
data.body:
<ihptru> are there any possible (even if not coded yet) ways to test if map is okay and playable? for OpenRA.Utility for example
<pchote> not yet
<pchote> but it could be done
<ihptru> would be great to test map by game automatically before allowing it for auto-downloading
<pchote> a RALint check for maps would be a sensible thing to do

data.title: Fatal Error dialog requires review and fix of layout
data.body:
screenshot is made on latest Linux Mint (15): http://i.imgur.com/001WfZs.png

https://github.com/ScottNZ/OpenRA/blob/7f67b567f91d899c1fcb6a6aafa743c25bd29e1d/OpenRA.Game/Support/FatalErrorDialog.cs#L25

data.title: Snipers have a hard time killing infantry that are crawling.
data.body:
Because I guess when an infantry unit is crawling around they are given an armor bonus or something.

That brings up something else, might be cool if we could tell our infantry to lay down and stay that way. Like hit deploy and they go into crawl mode till you deploy them again and they will go back to walking.

data.title: Support respin tags that don't change the ingame version
data.body:
release-20130915 has some bad packaging bugs under linux that we really should fix, but these have no effect ingame so requiring everyone to upgrade would be bad.

I propose we support an `@X` suffix for tags which is dropped by `make version` and the packaging scripts (the generated packages would be named identically to the current versions). This would let us tag release-20130915@2 with the packaging fixes while retaining compatibility with existing installs.

data.title: two dogs create infinte loop while attacking
data.body: If two dogs attack at exact the same time, they cant kill each other cause they jump where the other dog stood, and vice versa.

data.title: Desync in release-20130915 involving Missile
data.body: http://diffchecker.com/ufgnjtue ticks and pos differs. Also note the irritating "No sync report available!" on top.

data.title: Sound volume auto increases at end game
data.body:
a small but annoying bug!
every time you surrender or win a skirmish game, the sound just goes crazy up, the sound effect boom, "kills" your ears. specially if you play with headsets.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/912636-sound-volume-auto-increases-at-end-game?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Removed executable bits for some maps
data.body:
Stumpled upon strange rpmlint errors when updating the openSUSE games package

```
openra.noarch: W: script-without-shebang /usr/share/openra/mods/cnc/maps/the-hot-box/map.yaml
This text file has executable bits set or is located in a path dedicated for
executables, but lacks a shebang and cannot thus be executed.  If the file is
meant to be an executable script, add the shebang, otherwise remove the
executable bits or move the file elsewhere.

openra.noarch: W: no-manual-page-for-binary openra
openra.noarch: W: no-manual-page-for-binary openra-editor
Each executable in standard binary directories should have a man page.
```

and found some more files in mods/*/maps that had chmod +x set.

data.title: Makefile: Add geoip so it gets installed
data.body: Without adding it to CORE it does not get installed and the game crashes.

data.title: System.InvalidOperationException: Can't create OpenAL device
data.body:
Dear community,
I have fail using Open RA with the following exception. (Widows 7, SP1, intel i3 2120 CPU 4Go, 64bit)

Have you any idea to fix it ?

Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Can't create OpenAL device
   à OpenRA.OpenAlSoundEngine..ctor()
   à OpenRA.Sound.CreateEngine(String engine)
   à OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   à OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   à OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

thanks
PetitCaillou

data.title: Fixed Unresolved=InfiltrateForCashInfo Missing=InfiltratableInfo in Monster Tank Madness
data.body: could not test the whole mission as the V2 destroyed my sub pen after I captured it because I was too slow.

data.title: Renamed RALint → OpenRA.Lint
data.body: it belongs into the project namespace.

data.title: Use the Makefile install rules for our packaging
data.body: so we stumble upon errors earlier and to help upstream.

data.title: List files again to avoid owning standard dirs in RPM
data.body:
reverts commit 9d256d93a59302c06d26f36c88125ce574d7e360

fixes file /usr/bin from install of openra-release.20130915-1.noarch
conflicts with file from package filesystem-3.2-13.fc19.x86_64

reported by @Samoi via IRC

data.title: Game admin tooltip shows client instead of server IP in lobby
data.body:
release-20130915

Found out about it when @JOoGraphics hosted a game. The lobby showed my IP and location in his tooltip.

This does not happen in the server browser.

data.title: Website - Broken patch notes link
data.body:
On http://openra.res0l.net/news/release-20130915/

'optimized changelog' leads to a page that does not exist

data.title: Website - Broken forum link
data.body:
Broken forums link on this page: http://openra.res0l.net/get-involved/

"Our forum" should redirect to http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewforum.php?f=80

data.title: Update OpenRA.nsi
data.body:
My first attempt at modifying the NSIS installation file (to add a Desktop shortcut).
I have tried to create the windows installer but I got some errors with MakeNSISW. http://pastebin.com/mhTUUAPy

data.title: Update packaging scripts
data.body: These haven't been tested - people keep on reintroducing gnuisms into the packaging scripts, which breaks them for BSD userlands :(

data.title: Request a more general FBO depth format.
data.body: Some drivers / GPUs don't like `GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT16`. This should provide a safe fix for #3753 we can take before the pending release.
